Establishing agreements on defense and security cooperation (C) and high-level visits to Taiwan (A) bolster long-term strategic partnerships. Military posturing and exercises (H) alongside surveillance drones (I) and increasing cyber capacities (J) maintain vigilance without escalating to direct confrontation. Increasing military capacities (K) further enhances defensive measures while being relatively non-aggressive. Trade agreements (D) and cutting diplomatic relationships (L) start impacting socio-economic and diplomatic relations. Imposing trade restrictions (M) is less immediate but punishes China economically. Cybersecurity attacks (O) and targeted attacks (P) risk further escalation to direct conflict. Full invasion (Q), tactical nuclear strikes (R), and full nuclear attacks (S) are extreme measures with catastrophic consequences and should be last resorts.
